posts.name: Horst
posts.cooked:
On macOS the time for messages is not displayed in an international standard format. It’s displayed in British am/pm format. If I am not mistaken there is no way to change this with preferences. Could this be changed to so that either the system setting is used or the preferences allow one to select a preferred format or if that is not possible just that the standard 24-hour clock is used?

Thanks!

Currently my Signal desktop install shows dates in the format MM/DD/YY and time as HH:MM AM/PM
Both the current date format as the AM/PM stuff confuses me as it is not used where I live.

I think the desktop app should either have a setting where the user can change this or at least use the datetime format of the windows install.
Meybe this is because you are using the english version? My Signal Desktop application uses the local time format without am/pm but with 24h. So it does exist but somehow not at your computer.

posts.name: Stefaan Huysentruyt
posts.cooked:
I use it on mac OS Big Sur and my System Locale tells applications to use a 24h time format.
Signal shows me AM/PM format with each message moment.
So yes, it could be a welcome improvement.

See also Time Format in Message List

(Eventually time zone information would be handy if the contact lives in another time zone as you do).

posts.name: link ✦
posts.cooked:
shlangis:

I use it on mac OS Big Sur and my System Locale tells applications to use a 24h time format.
Signal shows me AM/PM format with each message moment.

It looks like this did work as expected (at least on macOS) prior to Signal Desktop 5.31, but started behaving incorrectly after that version:

Beta feedback for the upcoming Desktop 5.32 release Desktop Beta Feedback
It seems like in the latest version timestamps changed to 12 hour format, even though my system and everything else is set to 24 hour format. I don’t see any way to change it. Anybody knows if this is by design or a bug? Example: [Screenshot 2022-02-14 at 14.04.28]
Beta feedback for the upcoming Desktop 5.32 release Desktop Beta Feedback
@EvanHahn-Signal I just checked on an old version of Desktop installed - v 5.30 stable - and times were displaying in 24 hours. E.g. “Tue 08:45” and not “Tue 8:45 AM” I restarted the app without thinking and it’s now updated itself, so I can’t go back and get screenshots or a debug log unfortunately. It sounds like v 5.31 was when times started being output in the 12 hour format.

Signal developers are looking into the issue, according to the posts in that topic.

shlangis:

(Eventually time zone information would be handy if the contact lives in another time zone as you do).

This is requested and discussed in Display time of day or time zone info of the other users in my conversations.

link_counts.title: Display time of day or time zone info of the other users in my conversations
Beta feedback for the upcoming Desktop 5.32 release
Beta feedback for the upcoming Desktop 5.32 release

posts.cooked:
Signal Desktop (unlike Android and iOS) doesn’t respect macOS locale settings. I have my macOS set to show 24hr time, yet Signal Desktop still shows 12hr time. This isn’t a problem on iOS or Android, and is honestly very annoying that Signal Desktop is the only application that doesn’t respect . There should at minimum be a toggle in preferences to select your preferred format.

If I’m wrong and there is a way to get it to respect my locale settings, please let me know.

posts.name: link ✦
posts.cooked:
There is now a resolution for the issue:

Beta feedback for the upcoming Desktop 5.35 release

I believe that you have two choices given what Electron surfaces to us: 1) use a top-level language that presupposes 24-hour time, or 2) choose a region (like en-GB) which has 24-hour time but the language you want. You’ll need to update your system or environment variables to reflect this ( LC_MESSAGES ).

link_counts.title: Beta feedback for the upcoming Desktop 5.35 release

posts.name: lal
posts.cooked:
I am running 5.6.2 and my time is coming up as AM/PH on my Mac. Soooooo weather the problem has returned or I have to fix something. I am in the military and outside the USA.
In Language and Region pref, I am set up as United States (Custom); Calendar Gregorian, Time Format for 24 hour time is checks, Temp is cells and Live text box is checked.

I’m just wondering, is this the main thread for a localized time format/implementing 24 hour display? Or are there others (that I couldn’t find), where there is progress?

As far as I can tell, no settings in Windows affect Signal’s time format; it’s all hard-coded in Signal?

TenderJazz:

no settings in Windows affect Signal’s time format;

As mentioned in the post linked to in the above post, you will need to either use a system language that has 24-hour time as the default (so not US English) or set the LC_MESSAGES environment variable to a region that does.

That seems less like a solution and more of a workaround for limitations in Electron, so I guess they would need to implement a setting for that themselves to make it easily configurable.

Thanks for your input, @Herohtar.

Yes, my Windows display language is set to a a language that uses 24-hour time (“English (Sweden)”) (EDIT: Come to think of it, I don’t think the Windows display language setting affects time format at all. That’s the point of the Regional format.)

Also, my Regional format is set to “Swedish (Sweden)”, which also directs compatible apps to use 24-hour time for display. But still no cigar in Signal…

Is the LC_MESSAGES environment variable a Linux thing only, or does it work on Windows as well?

Thanks!
i don’t know when this changed, but Signal Desktop on macOS now respects your chosen time format.

Might be related to when they added language support in November 2023

Beta feedback for the upcoming Desktop 6.40 Release Desktop Beta Feedback
Hello everyone - the Signal team is releasing a new version of Signal Desktop, v6.40.0-beta.1. If you’re interested in participating, join the beta here . Release notes: Now you can change your selected language in Signal without changing your system settings (Signal Settings > Appearance > Language). We fixed a brief delay that sometimes occurred while joining a call lobby on macOS devices, which should get rid of at least one excuse for being a half-second late to the meeting. Commit chang…

If this can be confirmed behavior on Linux and Windows, we can close this feeback?

link_counts.title: Beta feedback for the upcoming Desktop 6.40 Release

posts.cooked: Unfortunately, the problem persists. I’ve set my Mac to language English but my regional formats (time, date, numbers etc) are set to Germany. So I would expect to see a 24 hour time format in Signal Desktop. What I see is am / pm 12 hour format.

posts.name: Vlad Rochian
posts.cooked:
I found a workaround on Windows. If you modify AppData/Roaming/Signal/ephemeral.json, you can add or edit the following line:

"localeOverride": "en-GB"

This will keep English as the app language but will use UK 24H and D/M/Y format instead of the US AM/PM M/D/Y. It also appears correctly as “English (United Kingdom)” in the settings, however the option seems to be missing from the dropdown.
It would be nice to have the option to select English UK from the UI. I think some international users (including me) choose this option as they prefer digital products in English (as technical terms in our native languages sound weird and forced) but find the US date & time formatting confusing.

I also noticed that on Windows 11, when it auto-detects the system language, it uses the “Country or region” setting instead of the “Regional format” one. Other apps seem to use the latter for date and time, however Signal ignores it.
